page.title: 18Local History.
page.content: Milborne St. Andrew Church. The tower has five bells. 1. 1616 recast 1898. 2. 1616 recast 1898. 3. 1616 recast 1898 "Praise the Lord". 4. "AN: NO: DO: MI: NI: FGH." 5. CAL: UPON: GOD: IWO: 1662: O. The bells swing outwards and in the past have caused some damage to the tower. Gifts to the Church are as follows, 1. A six branch chandelier, given by John Gould and dated 1712, only four of the branches now remain. 2. The Bishops oak chair, given by the Moreton family and dated 1670. 3. This is a George 3rd Royal Coat of Arms, unknown benefactor. 4. Oak pews, Mr. Pleydell, 1930. 5. A Victorian Chalice, paten, and silver wafer box, given anonymously. There are numerous other gifts and it is a most beautiful and picturesque church to visit.The churchyard was extended in 1985.
